{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3167153,"name":"Pedro","username":"mepedrol","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mepedrol/{size}/187240_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-18T00:08:43.405Z","cooked":"

Whats up guys, mepedrol here with a question about the signal light.
Our team has been having a problem with the signal light. We checked trhe RSL light on the robo rio, and its working ok, but the actual light on the robot blinks even when it’s disabled.
If anyone could help us we would really appreciate it.

mepedrol out

Have you write the RSL correctly? It requires a jumper wire at the RSL end.

Tom_Line:

It requires a jumper wire

To be clear: the Allen-Bradley signal light does. The also-legal AndyMark one does not.

(The AndyMark one was a project of mine, so I’m intimately familiar. It’s also one I bought with my own money to run on the 2023 Pandamaniacs robot, because when you’re given a flex like that in the 2023 rules you flex.)
